features: 【Do a Healthier Laundry】---Wash Separately: Infants and kids are delicate, they need excellent care. Undergarments can sometimes harbor numerous bacteria, demanding serious attention. With our mini washing machine, you can wash baby and kids' clothes separately and also your underwear or other small items(pet garments,small toys,towels...), avoiding cross-contamination and ensuring thorough protection for you and your family. Keep your family's clothing healthier with our small washer.

【Upgrade Capacity&Power】---More practical:Unlike most similar products with only 4.5L or 6.5L capacity and around 20W power, our mini washing machine has been upgraded to a generous 10L capacity and 60W power, allowing you to wash more at once and Definitely better value for your money!!

【Portable Washer】---Carry-on:The portable washing machine equipped with a drain pipe and a collapsible drain basket, the body only weighs 5.2 pounds, compact and easy to carry, it is an ideal choice for your apartment, dormitory, RV, travel or camping! It is also your ideal gift selection!

【One-Touch Control】---Simple Operation: Our mini washing machine features a user-friendly control panel with a single button. Simply press and hold for 2 seconds to power on/off. Press briefly to switch between a 5-minute or 10-minute wash cycle or a 1-minute spin-dry cycle (when using the spin basket). Effortlessly handle your laundry by adding clothes, water, and detergent, leaving the rest to the mini washing machine.

【Foldable Design】--- Compact:The small portable washing machine cleverly adopts a foldable design. Easy to store, fits easily between shelves or under a bed without taking up too much space in your home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Good. But Instructions PLEASE!
reviews.reviewText: Don’t get me wrong: This is a good, portable, compact mini-cleaner. My review cons for the product itself would be (1) no lock/latch on the lid to keep it down when the cycles are in use. The lid bounces open slightly, causing water/foam to splash out; and (2) the spin cycle basket did not stay in place for longer than a minute, even after multiple attempts to reattach it. You really need to press down hard on such a light-weight machine to click the basket into a locked position.My major problem is: How difficult is it to provide complete directions on how to USE the product?!? Sure, the collapsible feature is enticing, but does it take 7 of the 12 instructional photos provided to demonstrate how to do this? And then how to turn on the unit and push a cycle button? Does that really take an additional 3 pictures? There’s 10 out of 12 steps taken for “duh” instructions. What about:❓ How much water to use? True, its capacity is an impressive 10 liters (a little over 2.5 gallons), but by definition capacity = maximum. What if you’re using less water? Ok…maybe another product ‘ding’ would be water level markers on the inside of the “fuselage” (aka: the basin) to see how much water you are pouring in.❓ Recommendations as to how much detergent to use per X amount of water? (Be conservative: drip detergent in slowly and keep a watch on the foam factor, peeking under the latchless lid)❓ Guidance to use the basket only for the “dehydration” mode (aka: spin cycle). Goodness knows, it didn’t stay on for a full spin, but it was handy to use to rinse the clothes in the sink after the wash cycle(s). Also, could one use the 10 minute cycle for the actual wash, the stronger 5 minute cycle for a rinse, and then “dehydrate”?❓ Cleaning instructions: advice on how to drain the soapy water. The other side of the instructions (“Safety Precautions”) has all the legal disclaimers…it does state not to pour water on the lower part of the machine (obviously, where the mechanisms are). So, no lifting the light-weight unit under running water to rinse it out. What is recommended then? Also, any suggested steps (perhaps a good wipe/dry-down of the unit and return the drain pipe to its tucked-in position) before one follows the last 4 pictures on how to collapse it...Argh! I don’t want to give the unit a poor review since it’s very versatile, rather quiet and goodness knows those strong magnets certainly earn their keep. I’ve attached enhanced instructions to try to help, because for mobile purposes to use on the road, in a dorm or RV, or just for a small load at home, it’s a good thing. But…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good option for small items
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This little washing machine is actually a little bigger than I expected, but it’s easy to setup and works fairly good. I wanted to push it to more than just washing super small items like socks, and put in 5 pairs of underwear, a tshirt and a pair of leggings. They all washed well, surprisingly, but because I slightly overloaded it, it didn’t spin or swish as much - but it did enough. I added the water after the clothes, but I’d now recommend adding the water and detergent before the clothes. The dehydrating spin mode to wring the clothes out was a little frustrating , though. First, the basket would only hold the underwear - it was too small to hold all the pieces I washed to I had to split them. Then the basket wouldn’t stay well on the spinner. Every time I’d start the spin, it was so fast that the basket flew off the spinner. It took about ten times to get the basket on just right for it to stay on during the spin. Other than that, it’s a pretty handy little washer that’s good as a backup or to pack if traveling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Using the sink is easier
reviews.reviewText: Not sure what I expected but not for the basket to fly off during the "dehydrating" cycle when there was only a bra in it (and it's not a huge bra ~ not gifted in that department ; ) So you put water and detergent in, run the wash, refill with water to rinse, wring out the clothes and then you can try to spin. It did spin(ish) with only 4 pair of underwear. There are no instructions included, except for how to expand and fold back to small. To drain it the drain pipe has to be lower than the machine.
